sen.j: 藤原田麻呂（ふじわらのたまろ、養老6年（722年） - 延暦2年3月19日 (旧暦)（783年4月28日））は、奈良時代の公卿で左大臣。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tamaro (722-April 28, 783) was a court noble and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in the Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Tamaro (722 - April 28, 783) was a court noble and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in the Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Tamaro (722 - April 28, 783) was a court noble and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in the Nara period.

sen.j: 姓は朝臣。
sen.e: His ranked title was Ason.
His clan rank title was Ason.
sen.cmt: His ranked title → His clan rank title
sen.e: His clan rank title was Ason.

sen.j: 号は蜷淵大臣。
sen.e: His pseudonym was Ninabuchi daijin.
His pseudonym was Ninabuchi-daijin.
His pseudonym was Ninabuchi-daijin.

sen.j: 参議藤原宇合の四男。
sen.e: He was the fourth son of a Councilor FUJIWARA no Umakai.
He was the fourth son of a Councilor FUJIWARA no Umakai.
He was the fourth son of a Councilor FUJIWARA no Umakai.

sen.j: 母は小肆小治田朝臣功麿男牛の養女。
sen.e: His mother was an adopted daughter of Shoshi OHARIDA Ason Isamaro Nangyu.
sen.cmt: 小肆小治田朝臣功麿男牛⇒詳細不明
sen.e: His mother was an adopted daughter of 小肆小治田朝臣功麿男牛.
His mother was an adopted daughter of 小肆小治田朝臣功麿男牛.

sen.j: 兄に藤原広嗣、藤原良継、藤原清成、弟に藤原綱手、藤原百川、藤原蔵下麻呂がいる。
sen.e: He had elder brothers, FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, and younger brothers, FUJIWARA no Tsunate, FUJIWARA no Momokawa and FUJIWARA no Kurajimaro.

He had elder brothers whose names were FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, and younger brothers whose names were FUJIWARA no Tsunate, FUJIWARA no Momokawa and FUJIWARA no Kurajimaro.

He had elder brothers whose names were FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, and younger brothers whose names were FUJIWARA no Tsunate, FUJIWARA no Momokawa and FUJIWARA no Kurajimaro.

sen.j: 740年 兄・藤原広嗣の事件に連座して隠岐国に配流。
sen.e: 740: Implicated in his brother FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu's affair, exiled to Oki Province.
In 740, he was involved in his brother FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu's affair and exiled to Oki Province.
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加Implicated → was involvedカンマを and に変更
sen.e: In 740, he was involved in his brother FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu's affair and exiled to Oki Province.

sen.j: 742年 許されて蜷淵山に隠居。
sen.e: 742: Permitted to go into retirement in Mt. Ninabuchi.
In 742, he was permitted to go into retirement in Mt. Ninabuchi.
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 742, he was permitted to go into retirement in Mt. Ninabuchi.

sen.j: 761年 従五位下に叙され西海道節度使となる。
sen.e: 761: Conferred the Imperial Court Rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to become Setsudoshi (military governor) on Saikai-do Road.
In 761, conferred the Imperial Court Rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), he became Setsudoshi (military governor) of Saikaido region (Western-sea region).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加on Saikai-do Road → of Saikaido region (Western-sea region)
sen.e: In 761, conferred the Imperial Court Rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), he became Setsudoshi (military governor) of Saikaido region (Western-sea region).

sen.j: 763年 美濃守・右中弁・外衛中将に任ぜられ陸奥出羽按察使となる。
sen.e: 763: Appointed to be Mino no kami (Governor of Mino Province), Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right) and Gaie chujo (Outer Guards Lieutenant General) to become Mutsu Dewa Azechi (Inspector of the provincial government in Mutsu and Dewa).

In 763, appointed as Mino no kami (Governor of Mino Province), Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right) and Gaie chujo (Outer Guards Lieutenant General), he became Mutsu Dewa Azechi (Inspector of the provincial government in Mutsu and Dewa).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 763, appointed as Mino no kami (Governor of Mino Province), Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right) and Gaie chujo (Outer Guards Lieutenant General), he became Mutsu Dewa Azechi (Inspector of the provincial government in Mutsu and Dewa).

sen.j: 765年 正五位上に進み、外衛大将になる。
sen.e: 765: Promoted to the Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Court Rank, Upper Grade) to become Gaie taisho (Outer Guards General).
In 765, he was promoted to the Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Court Rank, Upper Grade) and became Gaie taisho (Outer Guards General).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 765, he was promoted to the Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Court Rank, Upper Grade) and became Gaie taisho (Outer Guards General).

sen.j: 766年 丹波守・大宰大弐・兵部卿に任ぜられ、従四位下より従四位上に進み、更に参議に任ぜられる。
sen.e: 766: Appointed as Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province), Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) and Hyobukyo (Minister for Military Affairs), promoted from the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade) to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and also appointed as Sangi (Councilor).

In 766, he was appointed as Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province), Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) and Hyobukyo (Minister for Military Affairs), promoted from the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade) to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and also appointed as Sangi (Councilor).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 766, he was appointed as Tanba no kami (Governor of Tanba Province), Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) and Hyobukyo (Minister for Military Affairs), promoted from the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade) to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and also appointed as Sangi (Councilor).

sen.j: 767年 右兵衛督に任ぜられる。
sen.e: 767: Appointed as Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards).
In 767, he was appointed as Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 767, he was appointed as Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards).

sen.j: 768年 右兵衛督を辞す。
sen.e: 768: Resigned Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards).
In 768, he resigned Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 768, he resigned Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards).

sen.j: 再び大宰大弐に任ぜられ検校兵庫将軍となる。
sen.e: Appointed as Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) again, he became Kengyo hyogo shogun (Armory Guards General).
Appointed as Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) again, he became Kengyo hyogo shogun (Armory Guards General).
Appointed as Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu) again, he became Kengyo hyogo shogun (Armory Guards General).

sen.j: 770年 正四位下を叙される。
sen.e: 770: Conferred the Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade).
In 770, he was conferred the Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 770, he was conferred the Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 771年 正四位上より従三位に進み、兵部卿に任ぜられる。
sen.e: Promoted from the Imperial Court rank of Shoshiinojo (senior fourth court rank, upper grade) to Jusanmi (junior third court rank), he was appointed as Hyobukyo (Minister of Military Affairs) in 771.
Promoted from the Imperial Court rank of Shoshiinojo (senior fourth court rank, upper grade) to Jusanmi (junior third court rank), he was appointed as Hyobukyo (Minister of Military Affairs) in 771.
Promoted from the Imperial Court rank of Shoshiinojo (senior fourth court rank, upper grade) to Jusanmi (junior third court rank), he was appointed as Hyobukyo (Minister of Military Affairs) in 771.

sen.j: 774年 兵部卿を辞す。
sen.e: 774: Resigned Hyobukyo (Minister of Military Affairs).
In 774, he resigned Hyobukyo (Minister of Military Affairs).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 774, he resigned Hyobukyo (Minister of Military Affairs).

sen.j: 776年 摂津大夫となる。
sen.e: 776: Became Settsudaibu (a master of Settsu Province).
In 775, he became Settsudaibu (a master of Settsu Province).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 775, he became Settsudaibu (a master of Settsu Province).

sen.j: 778年 中衛権大将・中務卿に任ぜられる。
sen.e: 778: Appointed as Chue gontaisho (Inner Guards Vice-general) and Nakatsukasakyo (Minister of the Central Affairs).
In 778, he was appointed as Chue gontaisho (Inner Guards Vice-general) and Nakatsukasakyo (Minister of the Central Affairs).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加
sen.e: In 778, he was appointed as Chue gontaisho (Inner Guards Vice-general) and Nakatsukasakyo (Minister of the Central Affairs).

sen.j: 779年 正三位に進み中納言・東宮伝奏に任ぜられる。
sen.e: 779: Promoted to the Shosanmi (Senior Second Court Rank), appointed to be Chunagon (Vice-councilor of the state) and Togu denso (Reporter to the Crown Prince's Palace).
In 779, promoted to the Shosanmi (Senior Second Court Rank), he was appointed as Chunagon (Vice-councilor of the state) and Togu denso (Reporter to the Crown Prince's Palace).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正主語を追加appointed to be → was appointed as
sen.e: In 779, promoted to the Shosanmi (Senior Second Court Rank), he was appointed as Chunagon (Vice-councilor of the state) and Togu denso (Reporter to the Crown Prince's Palace).

sen.j: 781年 東宮伝奏を辞すが、大納言に任ぜられる。
sen.e: 781: Resigned Togu denso, but appointed to be Dainagon (Great Councilor).
In 781, although he resigned Togu denso, he was appointed as Dainagon (Great Councilor).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正Resigned → although he resignedbutを削除appointed to be → he was appointed as
sen.e: In 781, although he resigned Togu denso, he was appointed as Dainagon (Great Councilor).

sen.j: 782年 従二位に進み、右大臣・皇太子伝奏に任ぜられる。
sen.e: 782: Promoted to the Junii (Junior Second Court Rank) to become Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Kotaishi denso (Reporter to the Crown Prince).
In 782, promoted to the Junii (Junior Second Court Rank), he became Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Kotaishi denso (Reporter to the Crown Prince).
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正to become → he became
sen.e: In 782, promoted to the Junii (Junior Second Court Rank), he became Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Kotaishi denso (Reporter to the Crown Prince).

sen.j: 783年 左大臣に任じられるも62歳で死去。
sen.e: 783: Appointed to be Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), but passed away at age 62.
In 783, although he was appointed as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), he passed away at the age of 62.
sen.cmt: 年号の表記を修正Appointed to be → although he was appointed asbutを削除passed → he passed
sen.e: In 783, although he was appointed as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), he passed away at the age of 62.

sen.j: 没後に正二位を贈られる。
sen.e: The Imperial Court rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) was given after his death.
The Imperial Court rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) was given after his death.
The Imperial Court rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) was given after his death.

sen.j: 藤原田麻呂の長男は田上二十七代と称され、正五位下に叙されている。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tamaro's oldest son, called 田上二十七代, was conferred the Imperial Court rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 田上二十七代⇒読み方不明
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tamaro's oldest son was called the twenty-seventh generation descendant of 田上 and conferred the Imperial Court rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: called → was called二十七代 → the twenty-seventh generation descendant読み方不明
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tamaro's oldest son was called the twenty-seventh generation descendant of 田上 and conferred the Imperial Court rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: よって、藤原田麻呂の子孫は"田上"という姓名になった。
sen.e: Therefore, the surname of FUJIWARA no Tamaro's descendants was changed into "田上."
Consequently, the family name of FUJIWARA no Tamaro's descendants became "田上."
sen.cmt: Therefore → Consequentlythe surname → the family namewas changed into → became読み方不明
sen.e: Consequently, the family name of FUJIWARA no Tamaro's descendants became "田上."

sen.j: 田上二十七代の子孫、藤原光教（田上光教）は、従四位下に叙され、讃岐守に任じられている。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Mitsunori (Mitsunori 田上), a descendant of 田上 二十七代, was given the Imperial Court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed to be Sanuki no kami (Governor of Sanuki Province).
sen.cmt: 藤原光教（田上光教）⇒読み方不明
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Mitsunori (Mitsunori 田上), the twenty-seventh generation descendant of 田上, was given the Imperial Court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Sanuki no kami (Governor of Sanuki Province).
sen.cmt: 読み方不明二十七代 → the twenty-seventh generation descendant
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Mitsunori (Mitsunori 田上), the twenty-seventh generation descendant of 田上, was given the Imperial Court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and appointed as Sanuki no kami (Governor of Sanuki Province).

sen.j: 更にその子孫には一志郡八太村八大夫となった田上光久という人物もいる。
sen.e: There was other descendant called Mitsuhisa 田上, who became 八大夫 of Hatta Village, Ichishi County.
There was another descendant named Mitsuhisa 田上 who became 八大夫 of Hatta Village, Ichishi County.
There was another descendant named Mitsuhisa 田上 who became 八大夫 of Hatta Village, Ichishi County.

tit.e: A place associated with FUJIWARA no Tamaro
A place associated with FUJIWARA no Tamaro

sen.j: 春日神社 (春日市)
sen.e: Kasuga-jinja Shrine (Kasuga City)
Kasuga-jinja Shrine (Kasuga City)
Kasuga-jinja Shrine (Kasuga City)

sen.j: 福岡県春日市にある神社。
sen.e: It is a Shinto shrine located in Kasuga City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
It is a Shinto shrine located in Kasuga City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
It is a Shinto shrine located in Kasuga City, Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 大宰大弐であった神護景雲二年（768年）にその社殿を創建。
sen.e: The main building of the shrine was built in 768 when he was Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu).
The main building of the shrine was built in 768 when he was Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu).
The main building of the shrine was built in 768 when he was Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of the Dazai-fu).
